article.headline: Niagara 79, Yale 62
article.story: NEW HAVEN, Conn. (AP) -- Juan Mendez scored 25 points and Tremmell Darden added 20 to lead Niagara to a 79-62 win over Yale in a non-league game Saturday. James Reaves added 12 points and 13 rebounds for the Purple Eagles (6-1), who used a 19-8 run midway through the second half to run away with the game. Junior center Dominick Martin connected on eight of 10 field goal attempts to lead Yale with 16 points. The Bulldogs (4-5) turned the ball over 21 times and lost for the third straight time. Each of the three losses has come to teams from the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference. Junior guard Edwin Draughan added 12 points, six rebounds and six assists for Yale. Freshman forward Sam Kaplan had eight points. Niagara, averaging 93.3 points per game, was held to fewer than 80 for just the second time this season. The Purple Eagles shot just 36.7 percent from the field in the first half, which saw six ties and three lead changes.
